name: Great Keelyards
role_in_state: primary shipbuilding and reagent transshipment hub
economy_niches: warehousing and transshipment for coastal trade
culture_adjustments: boat-houses operate as hereditary guild households
launch and keel-mark rites more formalized and public
stronger commercial legalism over kin ties in port dealings
seasonal taboos extended to reagent handling and storage
practical fusion of ritual and craft standards for export quality
constraints: dense flammable stores limit open-flame processes
chartered shipwright monopolies restrict new workshops
notes: keel-marks and launch rites registered by boat-house elders
supplies vital for state fleets and ritual supply chains
navigational songs kept locally for launching and harboring
